item.description:
Ok, since I have to work this weekend, Saturday most likely and maybe Sunday too..??....So I can?t post a decent enough kayak trip.
Most Likely next weekend will be Chapman Pond and WaleBone Cove located near the Goodspeed Opera House Or the Bantam River in Bantam CT..not sure yet.. If I dont work Sunday and its good out..then i will post one of em..

SO instead wouldn?t it be nice to have a short hike to a nice flat area near the first set of open area at the top path of the Heublin Tower for a small dinner, snacks and wine (other beverage too for non wino?s) for a sunset socializing event?
I don?t plan on going to all the way to the tower, but its an option if there is enough time.

We can?t stay up there too much past sunset since im not sure how strict the rules are enforced for a park closing at sunset?
We can find out im sure?.

Getting There:
Look for the signs for Talcott Mountain/Hebulin Tower State Park area (south side of rte 185), its right across from Penwood State Forest if you missed it..
Go up the entrance way for a short distance, you will see the parking area off to the right across from the trail head on the left. I will have the Red Chevy Blazer with the plate WWU

Since this is in an odd location for most of your routs of travel..
Please check your maps.
For Mapquest, GPS or others, 130 Hartford Road (rte 185), Simsbury, CT will get you close enough.
